Description: Ostracon, fragment of the shoulder section of a brown-coloured pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous substance, the exterior is covered with a brown-coloured slip and bears traces of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.217)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87689) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87689)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 378 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
